migraph 0.7.0
  • Reference
  • News

Reference

Creation and Simulation

Functions for creating and simulating multimodal and multilevel networks:

create_empty() create_complete() create_ring() create_components()

Create networks that conform to particular structures

Data

The package contains a range of different multimodal and multilevel data, including data used in the book ‘Multimodal Political Networks’ (prefixed with ‘mpn_’):

southern_women

Two-mode southern women dataset

mpn_bristol

Bristol protest events, 1990-2002

mpn_elite_mex

One-mode Mexican power elite database

mpn_elite_usa_advice

Two-mode American power elite database

mpn_elite_usa_money

Three-mode American power elite database

mpn_IT_1990 mpn_IT_2008 mpn_DE_1990 mpn_DE_2008 mpn_UK_1990 mpn_UK_2008

European Values Survey, 1990 and 2008

mpn_ryanair

Ryanair data, EU policy influence network in June 2004

mpn_DemSxP mpn_RepSxP mpn_OverSxP

112th Congress Senate Voting

Classes

Functions for coercing objects between different classes and testing the properties of migraph-consistent objects:

as_matrix() as_igraph() as_tidygraph() is_twomode()

migraph-consistent object classes

Manipulation

Functions for manipulating multimodal networks:

project_rows() project_cols()

Projecting two-mode objects into one-mode objects

Visualisation

Functions for visualising multilevel networks:

plot(<igraph>)

Plotting of one-mode and two-mode graphs

Measures

Functions for measuring multimodal and multilevel networks:

node_degree() node_closeness() node_betweenness() node_eigenvector()

Centrality for one- and two-mode networks

node_constraint()

Constraint for one- and two-mode networks

node_smallworld()

Watts-Strogatz small-world model for two-mode networks

graph_degree() graph_closeness() graph_betweenness()

Centralization for one- and two-mode networks

graph_clustering()

Clustering for one-, two-, and three- mode networks

Models

Functions for modelling multimodal and multilevel networks:

netlm() summary(<netlm>) print(<summary.netlm>)

Linear regression for multimodal network data

Contents

Developed by James Hollway.
